source_quote: keeping an eye out for them when you see clear one-sided delivery and we've moved into premium when we have a bullish bias

signature.condition: IF price makes one-sided delivery into premium AND we have a bullish bias
signature.action: THEN look for bearish breaker formation (last significant down candle before BSL sweep)
signature.drawer_basis: explicitly references premium/discount positioning as validation criteria

signature.condition: IF price makes one-sided delivery into discount AND we have a bearish bias
signature.action: THEN look for bullish breaker formation
signature.drawer_basis: explicitly references premium/discount positioning as validation criteria

source_quote: Don't look for them at the beginning of runs... You'll spot them a lot at the beginning of runs but these aren't one's we're interested in

signature.condition: IF breaker forms at the beginning of a run
signature.action: THEN do NOT trade it (low probability, likely to move into opposing LTF PD array)
signature.drawer_basis: validation based on position within price range/run

source_quote: the easiest way to identify them is they're high probability OB's for the opposing direction that have an engulfing candle close through and above/below them

signature.condition: IF high probability OB for opposing direction has engulfing candle close through and above/below it
signature.action: THEN identify this as a breaker block
signature.drawer_basis: structural identification pattern for market structure element

source_quote: when valid you can treat and approach them the same as we see OB's

signature.condition: IF breaker is validated (correct P/D side, not at beginning of run)
signature.action: THEN treat and approach them the same as order blocks for entry
signature.drawer_basis: describes how to use breaker as entry model similar to OB

signature.condition: IF entry is taken below 50% of dealing range (M/T marked)
signature.action: THEN stop loss tunes into breakeven plus
signature.drawer_basis: trade management rule based on P/D position
